title: Reasons why the new ranked system creates an equally toxic environment
body:
Everyone thought that this new ranked system would make most people less toxic however its almost like it gets even worse now.
People have clearly set their preferences so when they start feeding the line 'dont play x in y role if you dont know how to play it etc' or 'you pref mid yet you feed nice one ******'  it seems the new ranked system seems to be more effective in non toxic pre game lobbies but worse toxicity during the actual games.

what are your opinions ?

replies.body:
My experience has been pretty good (bronze). Only a few incidents in the forty or so games ive played.

Salters gonna find a reason to salt, nothing can change that

To be fair, feeding is a sign of not knowing the mechanics of that lane or the counters available leading to an insane advantage being built up from a mistake which snowballs because you keep making said mistake.

Theres a reason most people dont feed when they play their mains.

Thats what the pref system was supposed to avoid, but seemingly its more prevalent now because people who are really good at seemingly boring roles queue the more exciting ones despite having little to no experience.
